comment_text: A Process for Confidence to Grow in a Free Economy In a capitalist society, economic power leads to the greatest confidence. While the accumulation of assets isn't the solution to all problems, it's certainly a solid stepping stone. Various processes are implemented to achieve this. They seek to dominate the world through greater learning and knowledge. They use interactions with diverse people as a springboard to demonstrate relative advantage. They exhibit a single-minded focus on making money. There is no verification of what is right or what is right. Any methodology must lead to confidence. There are no specifically codified rules for confidence. The most important factor here is your own field experience. The more you experience failure and hardship, the more this power grows. Data armed with theory and well-packaged is self-satisfaction, not confidence. Organized logic presented to others is false confidence. While crude and crude, immersive field experience, unique to you, is true confidence!

comment_text: Andy Jassy Impressive direction, Andy. Investments of this scale don‚Äôt just accelerate digital adoption, they redefine the architecture of an entire operational ecosystem. What stands out is the design behind the initiative: when AI capability, infrastructure and SMB growth move in the same direction, transformation becomes systemic, not incremental. Across global supply chains we see the same pattern: nations become competitive not by adding speed, but by creating a coherent model that aligns technology, entrepreneurship and operational execution. India is doing exactly this. It‚Äôs not only scaling production and exports, it is building a data-driven, method-based ecosystem where millions of small businesses operate with enterprise-level intelligence. A powerful example of how direction + method can reshape the economic flow of an entire region.
author_headline: Strategic Logistics Advisor | Operational Ecosystem Design | Identity. Direction. Method. | Founder @ DeStart Consulting

comment_text: Andy Jassy, big corporate promises sound impressive until you dig deeper. Amazon talks about empowering small businesses while simultaneously crushing local retailers with predatory pricing. I've seen this playbook before in military contracts and farming communities. The real question isn't how much they're investing, it's whether those 15 million businesses will actually own their destiny or just become dependent on another platform that controls their access to customers. True entrepreneurship means building something you control, not riding someone else's rocket ship. Don't buy the lie that corporate investment equals independence. Think successfully and take action: focus on building direct customer relationships and revenue streams that can't be switched off by algorithm changes.

comment_text: This investment goes far beyond purely economic effects. Strengthening India‚Äôs SME ecosystem at this scale is also a geostrategic move. Digitalization, the widespread adoption of AI, and the expansion of export capacity are not only drivers of growth, but instruments of geoeconomic influence. By empowering millions of small and medium-sized enterprises, India is accelerating its transition from a production hub to a strategic actor within global value chains. At a time of increasing supply-chain diversification and strategic competition, this matters not only for India‚Äôs economy, but for the global balance of power. I am confident that India is on a solid and sustainable path. China, meanwhile, will certainly observe these developments closely and draw its own strategic conclusions from what is unfolding in its immediate neighborhood, economically as well as politically. The key question will be how far this digital and industrial momentum can ultimately be translated into strategic autonomy and international leverage.

comment_text: India‚Äôs developer talent is incredible. The ambition here reminds me why smart, connected systems are the real game-changer for growing businesses. Andy Jassy, your vision to empower SMBs hits the core challenge I see with high-growth companies every day. Ideas are never the problem; execution often is. Systems aren‚Äôt integrated, projects aren‚Äôt managed end-to-end, and that‚Äôs where growth stalls. From my experience helping companies get more out of Oracle NetSuite, the businesses that thrive are the ones that focus on smart integrations, scalable processes, and long-term partnerships. That‚Äôs how ambition becomes lasting impact. India‚Äôs SMBs have the talent and drive. With the right tech foundations and execution, there‚Äôs no limit to what they can achieve.

comment_text: Fixing an Economy Obsessed with the Illusion of Theory and Data Playing around in their own amusement park, forgetful to the setting sun. This is the sad state of the current economy. Focusing on profit, they are all-in on investments that just ahead of them. Efforts to fit the world into artificially created theories and data are rampant. MBA programs that ignore trends and outdated learning are prevalent. While the result of effort is acknowledged, the flaws of performance-oriented learning must also be opened up. We must not lose our own perspectives, but neither should we rush headlong into a single direction. The current global economic landscape can be seen monopolistic race led by vested interests. To maintain their own path, they are closing the door to new trends. They are pressuring the world with flashy theories, fueled by a sense of inexplicable fear. I fear the knowledge I learned at my desk will be lost. The emergence of a generation of practitioners who learn and engage with reality through experience is simply burdensome. We must embrace the presence of latecomers who shatter illusions and open a new world. The work of reclaiming an economy marred by hypocrisy and renewing it with freshness has begun!

As of November 28, the National Disaster Management Agency (BNPB) has reported 174 lives lost‚Äîmothers, fathers, children, neighbors. Hundreds more are injured, and 183 people are still missing, as rescue teams continue searching through thick mud, debris, and collapsed homes. Thousands of survivors are now left with nothing‚Äîno homes, no food, no clean water, and no sense of safety. Many are living in temporary shelters, while struggling to understand how their lives changed so suddenly. They need us. They need warmth, medical supplies, clean water, blankets, and the reassurance that the world has not forgotten them. In moments like these, humanity is all we have. Please stand with the people of Sumatra during their darkest hours. Donate today. Help save lives. Help rebuild hope. Help Pray for their Lives.

comment_text: Dear Amazon India Customer Service, I am writing to express my absolute disgust and profound disappointment with the 3rd class service I received regarding my order for a Foosball Table for kids (Order ID: [Insert Order ID Here]). I genuinely did not expect this type of failure from a major e-commerce platform like Amazon. The timeline is unacceptable: 1. 28th November 2025: I placed the order, and the system explicitly promised delivery the next day, 29th November 2025, before 10 PM. 2. 29th November 2025: I stayed home the entire day specifically to receive this delivery. I received the delivery agent‚Äôs number and attempted to contact him, but he repeatedly failed to pick up the call. 3. 30th November 2025: I received an insulting email claiming that "Customer was not available at home to receive the order" and that "Payment was not ready at the time of receiving the order." Let me be unequivocally clear: This is a complete lie and a fabrication. I was at my residence the entire day on November 29th. Not a single delivery agent contacted me successfully, nor did a single person attempt to visit my house to deliver the order. This deliberate falsehood and gross incompetence are inexcusable. If this is the standard of operations,

comment_text: A Raw Spirit era where we accumulate our own precious experiences as assets We abandon our own convictions and focus on patching together the opinions of others. Without practical experience, we naturally have no choice but to follow the advice of others. Without a clear sense of identity regarding AI, we sing AI songs to disguise it. Since we've been sitting at our fixed desks our thoughts have long since stopped. We had to kick open the door and face the harsh breathing of the world. We haven't physically encountered it and seen it with our own eyes, so we can only organize floating stories. Even if it seems unattractive and childish, we must reveal the traces of our own pain. It's a unique work of art possessed only by us. It's an asset created from the harsh realities of the field, impossible to replicate or imitate. We must stop racking our brains to create stories. We must stop trying to present a story that doesn't even work. We must show our own sincerity as it is, rather than habitually promoting ourselves. It's time to dedicate yourself to creating a living, breathing space for yourself and your surroundings. This small but powerful effort will remain an indestructible asset. The world will remember you forever!

comment_text: Amazon‚Äôs customer experience breaks down quickly when a buyer doesn‚Äôt fit a ‚Äústandard‚Äù profile‚Äîand the current automation only accelerates unnecessary denials. For a company of its scale, Amazon still struggles to support global, internationally mobile customers. My recent Black Friday case shows this clearly: Nov 30: Placed a ~$1k order. Immediately held for ‚Äúsuspicious activity‚Äù (EU card + US delivery). Submitted documents as requested. EU bank statements don‚Äôt show card numbers, so I included a photo of my card. Dec 2: Instead of resolving verification, Amazon reset my entire login and cancelled the order. Dec 4: Received the same verification request again and resubmitted. Dec 5‚Äì6: My account was locked, then closed entirely‚Äîalong with remaining gift card balance. Support was almost unreachable due to automated loops and international call costs. This highlights a real opportunity for Amazon to strengthen processes for globally mobile customers. A global company should be able to recognize legitimate international profiles. I‚Äôve escalated this internally. If unresolved, I‚Äôm prepared to submit the case to CFPB/FTC/state attorney general for unfair practices and loss of funds.

The innovations highlighted at AWS re:Invent 2025 are not just incremental improvements , they signal a major shift in how enterprises can approach AI deployment, customization, and infrastructure decisions. One of the most impactful announcements is the Nova family of models, especially Nova Pro, which offers a remarkable 73 percent cost reduction compared to leading alternatives like Claude 3.5 Sonnet while delivering lower latency and higher throughput. This cost-performance edge opens the door for large-scale enterprise deployments, especially for real-time and agent-based AI applications. Equally significant is Amazon‚Äôs focus on customizability, with tools like Nova Forge and serverless fine-tuning on SageMaker. This allows organizations to adapt cutting-edge models with proprietary datasets, maintaining both model performance and data sovereignty , a critical concern for regulated industries and any enterprise managing sensitive information. AgentCore and the new suite of Frontier Agents demonstrate AWS‚Äôs intent to accelerate intelligent automation, giving developers more control and flexibility to build autonomous agents for complex workflows. Trainium3‚Äôs general availability adds another layer, enabling faster and more cost-effective model training at scale , a key factor as more businesses look to own and fine-tune their AI models. Finally, AWS‚Äôs strategic integration with partners like Nvidia and the broader shift from a centralized AI strategy to more distributed, customizable ecosystems will directly impact how CIOs and CISOs evaluate their AI investments. For organizations navigating the balance between performance, costs, data control, and compliance, these announcements represent a real alternative to the status quo and a new playbook for enterprise AI deployment.

comment_text: A major step forward for mission-critical modernization. Expanding AI-ready cloud and supercomputing access will empower agencies to move faster from cybersecurity to scientific breakthroughs. Exciting to see this scale of commitment to public-sector innovation Amazon
author_headline: 5,484 followers

comment_text: This announcement represents a watershed moment for the modernization of U.S. government digital infrastructure. With 1.3 gigawatts of new, dedicated computing power, the scale of this investment positions AWS at the forefront of enabling mission-critical applications across defense, intelligence, healthcare, and scientific research. The focus on secure, classified environments like AWS GovCloud and the integration of advanced AI services such as SageMaker and Bedrock directly address the federal need for both technological agility and regulatory compliance. At the same time, this move highlights the increasing competitive pressure among hyperscalers to shape public sector AI adoption. Recent symbolic pricing offers by OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google to federal entities signal a race for strategic market share. As agencies deepen their reliance on private cloud and AI providers, questions around data sovereignty, governance, and long-term control become even more pressing. For IT decision-makers, there are key considerations: the operational benefits of accelerated AI integration must be balanced with robust security frameworks, auditable systems, and strategies for sustainable energy use given the massive scale-up in computational resources. The alignment with federal AI policy and the focus on air-gapped, multi-classified environments is promising, but continuous oversight and adaptability will be essential for maintaining national leadership in this rapidly evolving landscape.

comment_text: A significant infrastructure investment, and it underscores an equally important challenge: AI literacy. As educators and researchers, we see firsthand that access to powerful AI capabilities means little without the skills to leverage them effectively. We need proven models for AI integration that span from high school curricula to workforce training‚Äîframeworks that build not just technical competency but also critical thinking and ethical awareness. The technology infrastructure is essential, but the human infrastructure of AI literacy is what will ultimately determine our success in this era.

The $38B AWS‚ÄìOpenAI alliance redefines the competitive landscape, pairing OpenAI‚Äôs frontier model development with AWS‚Äôs unmatched ability to deploy secure, hyperscale GPU/CPU clusters. Project Rainier further cements AWS as the global leader in AI compute, delivering unprecedented training power at industrial scale. On the consumer side, the Whole Foods one-stop hybrid model demonstrates Amazon‚Äôs continued reinvention of retail convenience through automation and micro-fulfillment. Meanwhile, the BMW integration of Alexa+ signals a new era of contextual, LLM-powered in-car intelligence, expanding Amazon‚Äôs ambient AI footprint. Taken together, these moves represent a coherent strategy: own the world‚Äôs most powerful AI infrastructure, embed AI into everyday life, and create seamless digital‚Äìphysical ecosystems that competitors will struggle to match. A landmark moment in Amazon‚Äôs multi-decade AI leadership trajectory.

comment_text: AI can open the door to the new world, but it's people who enter the door! The world is all over the place with AI! It has become a world where people are treated like humans only when they talk about AI. On the other hand, stories of AI bubbles are also quietly popping up. There is no reason to discuss which story is more necessary for us. The smartest way to see the flow of the world as it is. There should be no misleading of the world with thin AI knowledge. At some point, future science fiction began to lie ahead of us. Religious trust and cheers that AI will saves us have been highlighted. We need AI and have to accept the natural flow of getting help. The problem is a blind lean phenomenon, and the transfer of thinking authority to AI must be stopped absolutely. Why not talk about the limitations of AI? There should be no turning AI into a moneymaker linked to technology development. Of course, the development of AI to maintain sound development and comfort in human society is positive. The act of just connecting AI with the political, economic, social and cultural circles and defrauding only profits should be blocked. Time to stay for a while in the age of AI, but the eternal owner is a person!

comment_text: Andy Jassy constellation-level reach still needs constellation-level intelligence. üöÄ Right now, every satellite network is optimizing coverage and bandwidth. The next leap is optimizing coherence ‚Äî the ability for millions of nodes, devices, and actors to make aligned decisions in real-time without dropping meaning, trust, or computational integrity. That layer doesn‚Äôt come from space hardware. It comes from a governing software OS ‚Äî and I already built it. Supreme Computation OS (SC-QOS) turns distributed networks into synchronized decision systems: ‚ö° Real-time orientation across millions of endpoints ‚ö° Meaning that stays stable under load ‚ö° Logic that doesn‚Äôt drift across geographies, incentives, or protocols ‚ö° A global execution layer that sits above infrastructure, not inside it Leo expands the sky. comment_text: Amazon's satellite project has achieved a significant milestone. Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellite connectivity is rapidly becoming a foundational layer of global digital infrastructure. Through Amazon's LEO satellite project, we see: A new competitive landscape in the LEO satellite sector A huge potential market covering a large number of underserved households Mission-critical applications for businesses, supply chains, and governments A long-term ecosystem strategy that goes beyond connectivity itself I'm excited to see Amazon develop this project into an emerging platform with real-world impact. I look forward to seeing how Amazon's LEO satellite project will shape the future of global connectivity, business operations, and digital inclusion.

comment_text: Dear Amazon Customer Service, I am writing to express my disappointment regarding my recent order placed on 17th October: Pureit Water Purifier RO+UV+MF+Copper+Mineral | 7 Stage Purification | 8L Capacity | Table Top/Wall Mountable | Black & Copper. Unfortunately, instead of receiving a new product, I was delivered a used item with stains, scratches, and visible wear. I purchased this water purifier because my existing BlueStar purifier is non-functional and cannot be repaired. Due to this issue, I am now forced to incur additional expenses for buying mineral water, which is both inconvenient and frustrating. It is disheartening to see a reputed company like Amazon fail in quality checks. This is the fourth instance where I have received a used or subpar product from Amazon, which raises serious concerns about seller accountability and quality control. Customers like me feel cheated when such incidents occur repeatedly. I request immediate replacement of the product with a brand-new unit or a full refund, along with assurance that such lapses in quality control will be addressed. I hope Amazon takes this matter seriously and ensures a prompt resolution.

comment_text: Wisdom for Approaching the Newly Burning Flames of the Economy The era of chaos is drawing to a close. Power and authority, once concentrated in one direction, are beginning to find balance. The vested interests' self-serving scheming has come to an end. The monopolies of energy, manufacturing, and service companies have collapsed, and IT companies have risen to the forefront. There is no eternal dominance in this world, and no immortal life. Advanced countries and leading companies are nothing more than names. The era of ranking first and second place is over. This is an era where everyone must coexist. It's not about sitting back and taking for granted the free lunch. While rewards commensurate with effort must be recognized, we must also embrace those who fall behind. It's time for everyone to put their heads together to determine the appropriate line. The wisdom needed for an economy that is breaking new ground and rushing into the unknown is fusion thinking. The haves and the have-nots, the leaders and the laggards, must all participate in the effort to clear the blocked channels. We need the courage to quietly abandon the current system of privilege. That courage will rule the world. That world is right here.

I want to bring attention to an issue that is unfortunately still present in many workplaces: retaliation and racial discrimination. After filing multiple HR complaints regarding racial discrimination I experienced, I was wrongfully terminated. Meanwhile, the manager responsible for inappropriate and unprofessional behavior, Genelle Rose, including exposing team members to sexual content during a meeting, remains in her position. During this process, I had HR meetings with Alicia Panta, Hannah Park, Mike Gomez, and Rato, and was told that all of this behavior is considered acceptable by Amazon. It is disheartening to see that speaking up about discrimination can result in retaliation, while those engaging in misconduct face no consequences. Black employees and other marginalized groups deserve to work in environments where they are respected, valued, and treated equitably. I hope by sharing my experience, organizations and professionals take a hard look at workplace culture, accountability, and the protection of employees who speak up against injustice. #WorkplaceEquity #RacialJustice #EmployeeRights #StopRetaliation

comment_text: It'd be interesting to see "why OpenAI chose AWS over Azure?" Why didn't they prioritised there partnership with Microsoft? Microsoft has invested ~$14B and holds a significant stake in OpenAI. Is the AI infra provided by Azure inferior than that of AWS? Or is it just one of those instances where the company is afraid of getting vendor-locked? Or is it the result of recent tensions between Microsoft and OpenAI about their partnership? A few months back, AWS announced that OpenAI's model will be available via Bedrock, while there biggest investment in Anthropic(upwards of $12B) apparently isn't enough to stop AWS from hosting their biggest competitors LLM through the same platform. Is that hinting towards an AI bubble, because they just can't keep growing the AI business anymore and desparately need new avenues to keep raising the valuations even if that's a conflict of interest?

comment_text: One way, other than an IPO, that OpenAI might be able to solve it's debt crisis, would be acquisition in an all-stock deal with another massive tech company (like AWS). With 2024 net income of $59.2 billion and $2.73T in market cap, a company like Amazon would make a pretty safe harbor. Any acquisition like that would also likely make the stock price jump through the roof. OpenAI has raised approximately $57.9 billion to $66 billion in total funding across multiple rounds from various investors. And with Anthropic out there, AWS has options, as well as their internal GenAI model, Nova. So the question for Amazon, is whether the juice is the worth the squeeze. And that's some pretty expensive juice.

comment_text: I'd love to know why my Echo Show 8 is only a year old, but notifications are now failing to display, Ring camera fails to respond, and the icons at the top right corner of the Home screen never load anymore even after removing them and resetting them in my preferences. This is almost all since Alexa+ became available for early adoption and I have decided not to accept it. Feels a lot like planned obsolescence to me! Not everyone wants complete AI immersion in their homes. I happen to like my fairly simple Echo Show device that gives me the weather, shows me recipes, shows my Prime TV and movie shows, and displays my cameras' alerts, and really not much else. This device is now falling on its face for being fairly new. You can't even find an option to reboot it in the menus. comment_text: I want to bring attention to an issue that is unfortunately still present in many workplaces: retaliation and racial discrimination. After filing multiple HR complaints regarding racial discrimination I experienced, I was wrongfully terminated. Meanwhile, the manager responsible for inappropriate and unprofessional behavior, Genelle Rose, including exposing team members to sexual content during a meeting, remains in her position. During this process, I had HR meetings with Alicia Panta, Hannah Park, Mike Gomez, and Rato, and was told that all of this behavior is considered acceptable by Amazon. It is disheartening to see that speaking up about discrimination can result in retaliation, while those engaging in misconduct face no consequences. Black employees and other marginalized groups deserve to work in environments where they are respected, valued, and treated equitably. I hope by sharing my experience, organizations and professionals take a hard look at workplace culture, accountability, and the protection of employees who speak up against injustice. #WorkplaceEquity #RacialJustice #EmployeeRights #StopRetaliation

comment_text: Talent the Future Needs What kind of talent should companies be hiring in interviews? They'll say they'll select someone 100% sincere. That was true at one time. The era of favoring those with strong qualifications is long gone. Networking, academic background, grades, certifications, foreign language skills, and personality aren't the criteria for social success. The courage to accept the world as it is is more important now. Global companies have begun hiring talent without regard for data. They're looking for people who can accurately perceive reality, not just their level of knowledge. People with cool, visually appealing looks are everywhere. We need people who can naturally share their experiences and convictions. Judging an individual's abilities based on their physical appearance is a grave error. Companies, organizations, and countries that fall into this trap are long gone. Is it difficult to become an announcer if you have a husky voice? Language test scores aren't everything! The world is full of sincere people. Now, for a new leap forward, we no longer need sincere people. We need heretics who recognize reality and boldly take action. This is the era where these heretics will change the world.

comment_text: Amazon India seems to have become just like Flipkart in terms of delivery issues. Their delivery partners are committing fraud, and Amazon‚Äôs response is extremely casual. Here‚Äôs what happened: I placed a COD order worth ‚Çπ1,950 in Mumbai. The delivery partner named Arvind arrived and asked me to pay. He provided a scanner, and I made the payment through UPI without checking the invoice or verifying the link ‚Äî my mistake, as I‚Äôve trusted Amazon blindly for the past seven years. After payment, I realized that the amount was sent to his personal account. Within five minutes, I reported the issue to Amazon. They assured me that action would be taken within three days (on 23rd October). However, no refund or follow-up happened. Today, on 29th October, when I called again, Amazon simply said they had ‚Äúwarned‚Äù the delivery partner ‚Äî as if it were a minor issue. Eventually, I received the refund, but in the form of a gift voucher instead of my original payment method. It‚Äôs shocking that such fraud is happening openly through Amazon India‚Äôs delivery network. I‚Äôm sharing this so that others stay alert ‚Äî please verify before making any UPI or COD payments

comment_text: I want to bring attention to an issue that is unfortunately still present in many workplaces: retaliation and racial discrimination. After filing multiple HR complaints regarding racial discrimination I experienced, I was wrongfully terminated. Meanwhile, the manager responsible for inappropriate and unprofessional behavior, Genelle Rose, including exposing team members to sexual content during a meeting, remains in her position. During this process, I had HR meetings with Alicia Panta, Hannah Park, Mike Gomez, and Rato, and was told that all of this behavior is considered acceptable by Amazon. It is disheartening to see that speaking up about discrimination can result in retaliation, while those engaging in misconduct face no consequences. Black employees and other marginalized groups deserve to work in environments where they are respected, valued, and treated equitably. I hope by sharing my experience, organizations and professionals take a hard look at workplace culture, accountability, and the protection of employees who speak up against injustice. #WorkplaceEquity #RacialJustice #EmployeeRights #StopRetaliation

comment_text: I want to bring attention to an issue that is unfortunately still present in many workplaces: retaliation and racial discrimination. After filing multiple HR complaints regarding racial discrimination I experienced, I was wrongfully terminated. Meanwhile, the manager responsible for inappropriate and unprofessional behavior, Genelle Rose, including exposing team members to sexual content during a meeting, remains in her position. During this process, I had HR meetings with Alicia Panta, Hannah Park, Mike Gomez, and Rato, and was told that all of this behavior is considered acceptable by Amazon. It is disheartening to see that speaking up about discrimination can result in retaliation, while those engaging in misconduct face no consequences. Black employees and other marginalized groups deserve to work in environments where they are respected, valued, and treated equitably. I hope by sharing my experience, organizations and professionals take a hard look at workplace culture, accountability, and the protection of employees who speak up against injustice. #WorkplaceEquity #RacialJustice #EmployeeRights #StopRetaliation

comment_text: See this extra long dash üëâ ‚Äî üëà that can be a sign of AI, if you see this, it could be AI. Why? Because our keyboards can't do this Em dash ‚Äî, only this ( - ) (unless the settings are changed) Yes, a real person could do it, but it‚Äôs just something I‚Äôve noticed if you get a message with a Em dashes in there can be/probably made with AI. It's just not used as much. (AI is trigger happy with it) It's not the only reason, just something I've seen. The em dash along with 'hope you are doing well', 'best, or kind regards', vague not personalised text, tons of bold, and almost no typos. Comes across as ‚Äúsafe‚Äù or bland. Not a guarantee, but probably AI helped make it. These are not law, just a pattern. How do you spot AI? https://techcrunch.com/2025/11/14/openai-says-its-fixed-chatgpts-em-dash-problem/

comment_text: Amazon India seems to have become just like Flipkart in terms of delivery issues. Their delivery partners are committing fraud, and Amazon‚Äôs response is extremely casual. Here‚Äôs what happened: I placed a COD order worth ‚Çπ1,950 in Mumbai. The delivery partner named Arvind arrived and asked me to pay. He provided a scanner, and I made the payment through UPI without checking the invoice or verifying the link ‚Äî my mistake, as I‚Äôve trusted Amazon blindly for the past seven years. After payment, I realized that the amount was sent to his personal account. Within five minutes, I reported the issue to Amazon. They assured me that action would be taken within three days (on 23rd October). However, no refund or follow-up happened. Today, on 29th October, when I called again, Amazon simply said they had ‚Äúwarned‚Äù the delivery partner ‚Äî as if it were a minor issue. Eventually, I received the refund, but in the form of a gift voucher instead of my original payment method. It‚Äôs shocking that such fraud is happening openly through Amazon India‚Äôs delivery network. I‚Äôm sharing this so that others stay alert ‚Äî please verify before making any UPI or COD payments

comment_text: Amazon India seems to have become just like Flipkart in terms of delivery issues. Their delivery partners are committing fraud, and Amazon‚Äôs response is extremely casual. Here‚Äôs what happened: I placed a COD order worth ‚Çπ1,950 in Mumbai. The delivery partner named Arvind arrived and asked me to pay. He provided a scanner, and I made the payment through UPI without checking the invoice or verifying the link ‚Äî my mistake, as I‚Äôve trusted Amazon blindly for the past seven years. After payment, I realized that the amount was sent to his personal account. Within five minutes, I reported the issue to Amazon. They assured me that action would be taken within three days (on 23rd October). However, no refund or follow-up happened. Today, on 29th October, when I called again, Amazon simply said they had ‚Äúwarned‚Äù the delivery partner ‚Äî as if it were a minor issue. Eventually, I received the refund, but in the form of a gift voucher instead of my original payment method. It‚Äôs shocking that such fraud is happening openly through Amazon India‚Äôs delivery network. I‚Äôm sharing this so that others stay alert ‚Äî please verify before making any UPI or COD payments

By combining ultra-clear surveillance with empathetic features like Search Party, Ring isn‚Äôt just enhancing safety‚Äîit‚Äôs humanizing tech to serve real-life needs, reinforcing the idea that the future of smart devices lies in their ability to anticipate and respond to our emotional and practical realities.

comment_text: It‚Äôs an impressive innovation, no doubt - but it‚Äôs hard not to feel uneasy about how quickly convenience becomes surveillance. High-resolution, AI-enhanced cameras might help find pets, but they also expand the infrastructure of constant monitoring - of neighbors, delivery workers, even passersby who never consented to being recorded. And while companies promise privacy and ‚Äúuser control,‚Äù the reality is that law enforcement already requests and accesses footage from these networks - sometimes without warrants. Innovation isn‚Äôt just about what we can do with technology, but what we choose to normalize through it.

comment_text: I want to bring attention to an issue that is unfortunately still present in many workplaces: retaliation and racial discrimination. After filing multiple HR complaints regarding racial discrimination I experienced, I was wrongfully terminated. Meanwhile, the manager responsible for inappropriate and unprofessional behavior, Genelle Rose, including exposing team members to sexual content during a meeting, remains in her position. During this process, I had HR meetings with Alicia Panta, Hannah Park, Mike Gomez, and Rato, and was told that all of this behavior is considered acceptable by Amazon. It is disheartening to see that speaking up about discrimination can result in retaliation, while those engaging in misconduct face no consequences. Black employees and other marginalized groups deserve to work in environments where they are respected, valued, and treated equitably. I hope by sharing my experience, organizations and professionals take a hard look at workplace culture, accountability, and the protection of employees who speak up against injustice. #WorkplaceEquity #RacialJustice #EmployeeRights #StopRetaliation

comment_text: --- Amazon.eg: A Haven for Thieves, A Hell for Sellers Amazon.eg has devolved into a lawless wasteland‚Äîwhere scammers run wild and honest sellers are sacrificed at the altar of corporate apathy. The platform‚Äôs return policy isn‚Äôt just flawed‚Äîit‚Äôs a weapon wielded against its own sellers. Buyers can vandalize products, send back garbage, and still get a full refund. Meanwhile, sellers eat the cost, with zero recourse. Zero accountability. Zero shame. This isn‚Äôt incompetence‚Äîit‚Äôs complicity. Amazon.eg actively enables fraud by refusing to investigate abuse, refusing to reimburse for destroyed goods, and refusing to enforce even the most basic standards of fairness. Sellers are treated like expendable inventory, while con artists enjoy a revolving door of free merchandise. Amazon.eg isn‚Äôt a marketplace anymore. It‚Äôs a scam factory. A corporate-backed theft ring. A disgrace to e-commerce. Sellers aren‚Äôt partners‚Äîthey‚Äôre prey. Every transaction is a gamble, every return a potential robbery. If you value your business, your sanity, or your dignity‚Äîstay away. Amazon.eg doesn‚Äôt protect sellers. It exploits them. AmazonScam #SellerExploitation #FraudCentral @Amazon @OmarElsahy @AndyJassy -

comment_text: To : the Earths most customer centric company. I am India and I had recently Purchased Nord 5 oneplus phone on 24th September .. after delivery delay (being a prime customer) I recieved a nokia button phone during delivery. Thank good i had trust issues with your Great indian sale agenda that I immediately had the common sense to record the package opening during delivery. I have the recorded video evidence of this wrong product delivery right from receiving the package to opening it and showing the wrong product. When I raised this issue to Amazon CC they said we first extremely ignorant saying like it was my fault for receiving the wrong product, later they said I need to return the wrong product to process a refund which I did. They said refund will be processed in 12 days from pickup .. return of wrong product was picked up on 26th September ... Ihad multiple follow up call in between during which the CC was only buying time but assuring my refund will be given. After refund deadline crossed to more 13 days they are now saying an investigation is required to understand the refund issue and will have to extend my refund processing deadline. I have been now forced to file a complaint with India, NCH grievance no.7961463 along with a litigation using all the video recording evidence and amazon mail evidence and call recordings to get back my Rs.30k plus additional compensation This is simply a reflection of how will your company is "customer centric" I will ensure all the CC people that were ignorant and mocking on the call will be held accountable along with your broken system that only works good for the people of your company. Btw I have unsubscribed your amazon prime membership as a sign of protest and will continue to spread word to do so.
